item.title: 2020 Retrospective
item.description: A look back on the major events and personal development that shaped my experience of 2020, and some thoughts on what I'd like to focus on in 2021.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)

item.title: 2020 Content Roundup
item.description: The books, movies, games and online content that I enjoyed the most or that affected me most profoundly in 2020.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)

item.title: Goodhart's Law: How Not to Read More Books
item.description: A discussion of the various helpful and unhelpful advice that I've come across in my quest to develop my reading habit.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)

item.title: Breaking the Curse of Expertise
item.description: Who am I to think I've got anything worth sharing in an online blog? This post explores why the attitude behind this question is misguided, how we've been taught to over-value "expertise", and my reasons for starting this blog to share my thoughts online.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)

item.title: `Shift + >` and the Importance of Making It Easy
item.description: One useful keyboard shortcut can make all the difference. This post discusses how the discovery of this shortcut changed my behaviour and significantly improved my life, and how this relates to habit formation more generally.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)

item.title: The Rule of Six
item.description: Restrictions on the size of social gatherings might seem initially to be purely a detriment to one's social life. However, their actual effect can be to encourage more intimate gatherings, leading to more meaningful interactions than one might find at larger events.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)

item.title: The Demon Haunted World of COVID-19
item.description: A look at what we can learn from Carl Sagan's 1995 book *The Demon Haunted World* about science denial and the value of scepticism in the age of COVID-19.
item.author: alex.stephens@eng.ox.ac.uk (Alex Stephens)
